GraphLib package¶

Submodules¶

GraphLib.DirectedGraph module¶

class GraphLib.DirectedGraph.DirectedGraph(name='', filename=None)¶

Bases: object

The class that implements a directed Graph.

It’s also the base class of all other Graphs.

addArc(origin, target)¶

Add an arc to the Graph. If a vertex of the new arc does not belong to the Graph, it is added to the Graph. If the arc already belong to the graph, a message is written but nothing is done.

addVertex(n)¶

Add a vertex to the graph. The resulting vertex is not connected to any other node of the Graph. If the vertex already belongs to the graph, a message is written but nothing is done.

getNeighbors(v)¶

Get the list of direct neighbors from vertex v

getPath(start, end, previous)¶

Most graph search returns a collection of recorded path from a certain vertex start to all accessible vertices (except in the case of early exit). These recorded paths can be implemented as a dictionnary called previous

previous : a dictionnary that contains all recorded paths. Each vertex accessible k is a key in the dictionnary. The value v associated to k is the vertex from which one should arrive to reach k

Hence, one can retrieve a path from start to any vertex end accessible by going backward in previous from end to its previous vertex and iterate until start is found.

returns a list of vertices found along the path from start to end

getPrevious(v)¶

Get the list of vertices that have v as a direct neighbor

printPath(path)¶

A path is a list of vertices. This function simply print every vertex in the path.

No verification is made that the list of vertices is really a path in the graph (the vertices should be successive neighbors).

runBreadthFirst(start)¶

The BreadthFirstSearch Algorithm : It will make a search of all accessible vertices, starting at vertex start.

returns previous : a dictionnary that contains all recorded paths. Each vertex accessible k is a key in the dictionnary. The value v associated to k is the vertex from which one should arrive to reach k

Hence, one can retrieve a path from start to any vertex a accessible by going backward in previous from a to its previous vertex and iterate until start is found. This is done by the getPath method

toDot(filename=None)¶

Produce a .dot output, as in the graphviz Library. If a filename is given, the method will save the produced string in a file. If not, it will be printed.

GraphLib.UndirectedGraph module¶

class GraphLib.UndirectedGraph.UndirectedGraph(name='', filename=None)¶

Bases: GraphLib.DirectedGraph.DirectedGraph

The class that implements an undirected Graph.

It is basically a directed Graph with symetrical arcs.

addArc(origin, target)¶

Add an undirected arc to the Graph. If a vertex of the new arc does not belong to the Graph, it is added to the Graph. If the arc already belong to the graph, a message is written but nothing is done.
